member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.IEffect
member.summary: Abstract interface representing an effect used for image processing.

remarks.p: IEffect is defined in such a way that it is possible to convert it to a D2D effect.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.IEffect.EffectId
member.summary: Gets a unique identifier for the effect.

remarks.p: Canvas built in effects return an EffectId that corresponds to the equivalent ID2D1Effect GUID on the platform.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.IEffect.Inputs
member.summary: Gets a collection of inputs attached to the effect.

remarks.p: Generic way to configure the inputs of an effect. In most cases, the properties of strongly typed IEffect subclasses (eg. GaussianBlurEffect) should be used instead.
It is possible to add, remove, or modify the Inputs.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.IEffect.Properties
member.summary: Gets the collection of properties specific to the current effect.

remarks.p: Generic way to configure the properties of an effect. In most cases, the properties of strongly typed IEffect subclasses (eg. GaussianBlurEffect) should be used instead.

New effects have all default properties set in advance. Size of vector corresponds to number of properties for current effect. The index values of the properties found on an effect match the D2D equivalent effect index values.
